items.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro sentenced to 27 years after being convicted of coup attempt
items.standfirst: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro, the far-right politician who governed Brazil between 2019 and 2022, was found guilty on five counts.
items.content: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro, the far-right politician who governed Brazil between 2019 and 2022, was found guilty on five counts.

items.title: Bolsonaro sentenced to 27 years for plotting military coup in Brazil
items.standfirst: Former president sought to ‘annihilate’ country’s democracy after losing 2022 electionExplainer: what did Bolsonaro’s trial reveal?​Brazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro ​has been sentenced to more than 27 years in prison for plotting a military coup​ and seeking to “annihilate” the South American country’s democracy.Justices Cármen Lúcia Antunes Rocha and Cristiano Zanin ruled on ​Thursday that Bolsonaro – a former paratrooper who was elected president in 2018 – was guilty of seeking to forcibly cling to power after losing the 2022 election, meaning four of the five judges involved in the trial had found Brazil’s former leader guilty. Continue reading...
items.content: Former president sought to ‘annihilate’ country’s democracy after losing 2022 electionExplainer: what did Bolsonaro’s trial reveal?​Brazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro ​has been sentenced to more than 27 years in prison for plotting a military coup​ and seeking to “annihilate” the South American country’s democracy.Justices Cármen Lúcia Antunes Rocha and Cristiano Zanin ruled on ​Thursday that Bolsonaro – a former paratrooper who was elected president in 2018 – was guilty of seeking to forcibly cling to power after losing the 2022 election, meaning four of the five judges involved in the trial had found Brazil’s former leader guilty. Continue reading...

items.title: Brazil's Supreme Court votes to convict ex-President Bolsonaro of a coup plot
items.standfirst: A historic conviction: Brazil's Supreme Court delivers a majority vote to convict former President Jair Bolsonaro over a plot to overthrow the government.
items.content: A historic conviction: Brazil's Supreme Court delivers a majority vote to convict former President Jair Bolsonaro over a plot to overthrow the government.(Image credit: Mateus Bonomi)

items.title: What did Jair Bolsonaro’s trial reveal about an attempted coup in Brazil?
items.standfirst: Far-right ex-president was found to have led a ‘criminal organisation’ to try to stay in powerBolsonaro found guilty of plotting military coupBrazil’s supreme court has made Jair Bolsonaro the first former president in the country’s history to be convicted for attempting a coup.The 70-year-old far-right leader claims he is the victim of political persecution, but three out of five judges concluded on Thursday that it was sufficiently proven that Bolsonaro and his close allies attempted to overturn the 2022 election, which he lost to Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva. Continue reading...
items.content: Far-right ex-president was found to have led a ‘criminal organisation’ to try to stay in powerBolsonaro found guilty of plotting military coupBrazil’s supreme court has made Jair Bolsonaro the first former president in the country’s history to be convicted for attempting a coup.The 70-year-old far-right leader claims he is the victim of political persecution, but three out of five judges concluded on Thursday that it was sufficiently proven that Bolsonaro and his close allies attempted to overturn the 2022 election, which he lost to Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva. Continue reading...

items.content: Bolsonaro set to be sentenced on charges related to planning coup after three justices vote to convict.

items.title: Brazilian Supreme Court judges vote to convict Jair Bolsonaro of attempting a coup
items.standfirst: The majority of a panel of Brazilian Supreme Court judges have voted to convict the country's former president Jair Bolsonaro of attempting a coup after his 2022 election defeat.
items.content: The majority of a panel of Brazilian Supreme Court judges have voted to convict the country's former president Jair Bolsonaro of attempting a coup after his 2022 election defeat.

ai_summary: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro was found guilty of plotting a military coup.
The sentence is for over 27 years in prison, according to multiple news sources.
Bolsonaro sought to cling to power after losing the 2022 election.
Four out of five judges involved in the trial found Bolsonaro guilty.
Trump responded to the conviction, calling Bolsonaro a "good man".

items.standfirst: Agency governor is legally challenging Trump after he sought to remove her, citing unconfirmed mortgage fraud allegationsA federal judge has ruled that a Federal Reserve board member, Lisa Cook, can stay in her post while suing Donald Trump over his unprecedented attempt to fire her.Cook is legally challenging the US president after he sought to remove her, citing unconfirmed allegations of mortgage fraud, amid an extraordinary campaign by his administration to strengthen its control over the US central bank. They are requesting an emergency ruling from an appeals court.
The request is to remove Cook before the next interest rate meeting.
Trump wants the Fed to lower rates to stimulate economic growth.
The administration's request is an extraordinary effort to influence the board.

clusters.title: OpenAI and Microsoft agree terms to unlock for-profit restructuring
clusters.neutral_headline: OpenAI and Microsoft agree key terms in contract renegotiation

items.title: OpenAI and Microsoft agree terms to unlock for-profit restructuring
items.standfirst: Nonbinding deal marks progress in talks to enable ChatGPT maker’s eventual IPO
items.content: Nonbinding deal marks progress in talks to enable ChatGPT maker’s eventual IPO

items.title: OpenAI and Microsoft sign preliminary deal to revise partnership terms
items.standfirst: Companies work to finalize terms as OpenAI pursues for-profit restructuring.
items.content: On Thursday, OpenAI and Microsoft announced they have signed a non-binding agreement to revise their partnership, marking the latest development in a relationship that has grown increasingly complex as both companies compete for customers in the AI market and seek new partnerships for growing infrastructure needs. "Microsoft and OpenAI have signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding (MOU) for the next phase of our partnership," the companies wrote in a joint statement. "We are actively working to finalize contractual terms in a definitive agreement. Together, we remain focused on delivering the best AI tools for everyone, grounded in our shared commitment to safety." The announcement comes as OpenAI seeks to restructure from a nonprofit to a for-profit entity, a transition that requires Microsoft's approval, as the company is OpenAI's largest investor with more than $13 billion committed since 2019.Read full article Comments

items.content: Microsoft Corp. plans to expand its physical infrastructure to train its own artificial intelligence models that it hopes will be competitive with OpenAI, Anthropic and other firms.

ai_summary: OpenAI and Microsoft reached a nonbinding deal to revise their partnership terms.
The agreement allows OpenAI to restructure and become for-profit.
Microsoft will provide more computing power for its in-house AI models.
OpenAI's nonprofit parent will own an equity stake of over $100 billion.
The restructuring could pave the way for OpenAI's eventual IPO.

items.title: Belarus frees 52 political prisoners, including foreigners, after visit by US delegation
items.standfirst: Move seen as effort to win US favour and sanctions relief, as crackdown on dissent continuesBelarus has released 52 prisoners of various nationalities, after a visit by a US delegation to Minsk, in Alexander Lukashenko’s latest attempt to balance ties between Russia and the west.Thursday’s prisoner release was one of the biggest of Lukashenko’s authoritarian rule, and was part of his effort to mend relations with Washington and secure sanctions relief after years of isolation. items.title: NATO forces shoot down Russian drones over Poland
items.standfirst: Polish officials say during a massive Russian air raid on Ukraine, 19 Russian drones entered Polish airspace. They say NATO forces scrambled and shot down at least four of those drones. Russia says no Polish sites were targeted for destruction, but Poland says the incursion was an intentional act. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports.
items.content: Polish officials say during a massive Russian air raid on Ukraine, 19 Russian drones entered Polish airspace. They say NATO forces scrambled and shot down at least four of those drones. Russia says no Polish sites were targeted for destruction, but Poland says the incursion was an intentional act. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports.

items.title: Here’s What to Know About Poland Shooting Down Russian Drones
items.standfirst: On Wednesday morning, Poland shot down several Russian drones that entered its airspace—a first since Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine. The incident disrupted air travel and set the region on edge.
items.content: On Wednesday morning, Poland shot down several Russian drones that entered its airspace—a first since Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine. The incident disrupted air travel and set the region on edge.

items.title: Poland shoots down 'huge number' of Russian drones
items.standfirst: Poland’s military said it scrambled its own and NATO allied air defenses to shoot down Russian drones on Wednesday after they crossed from neighboring Ukraine, the first time in the Ukraine war that Warsaw has engaged Russian assets in its airspace.
items.content: Poland’s military said it scrambled its own and NATO allied air defenses to shoot down Russian drones on Wednesday after they crossed from neighboring Ukraine, the first time in the Ukraine war that Warsaw has engaged Russian assets in its airspace.

ai_summary: NATO forces shot down Russian drones over Poland.
The drones entered Polish airspace from Ukraine.
Poland's military scrambled air defenses to engage Russian assets.
The incident is the first time Poland has engaged Russian assets in its airspace.

clusters.title: Accidental or deliberate? Russia's drone incursion into Poland is a test for Nato
clusters.neutral_headline: Russia's Drone Incursion into Poland is a Test for NATO

items.title: Accidental or deliberate? Russia's drone incursion into Poland is a test for Nato
items.standfirst: Whether the drone incursion was deliberate or accidental, Moscow will be watching Nato's response to it closely.
items.content: Whether the drone incursion was deliberate or accidental, Moscow will be watching Nato's response to it closely.

items.title: Flight tracking shows NATO response to Russian incursion in Poland
items.standfirst: The advance of Russian drones crossed into Poland around 1.50am local time, with several drones reportedly entering the country from Belarus.
items.content: The advance of Russian drones crossed into Poland around 1.50am local time, with several drones reportedly entering the country from Belarus.

ai_summary: The drone incursion into Poland is being closely watched by Moscow.
The advance of Russian drones crossed into Poland around 1:50 AM local time.
Several drones reportedly entered the country from Belarus.
